cyclone.name: LAURA
cyclone.current_location: about 55 miles south of the eastern tip of Cuba
cyclone.trajectory: moving west-northwest across Cuba tonight and Monday, then northwest across the Gulf of Mexico toward the northwest Gulf Coast (Texas–Louisiana) by late Wednesday-Thursday
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: northwest Gulf Coast near the Texas/Louisiana border

weather_observation.watch_coast: Tropical Storm Watches in effect for the Florida Keys, Florida Bay, central Bahamas and Andros Island
weather_observation.warning_coast: Tropical Storm Warnings for the northern coast of the Dominican Republic, all of Haiti, southeastern Bahamas, Turks and Caicos, and much of Cuba
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Greater Antilles now, spreading to the northwest Gulf Coast from Texas to Mississippi mid-week
weather_observation.wind: 34–50 kt (39–58 mph) winds possible late Wednesday night through Thursday with a 38% cumulative chance for tropical-storm force and 19% for 50-kt winds at the port.
weather_observation.storm_surge: Potential surge of 2–4 ft along the upper Texas coast, including Galveston Bay, depending on exact track and intensity.
weather_observation.rainfall: Heavy rain bands could deliver 4–6 inches with locally higher amounts, producing flash-flood potential in the Houston metro/port area.
weather_observation.other_hazards: Isolated tornadoes in outer rainbands and temporary channel restrictions due to high seas and reduced visibilities.
